website_summaries.verdict: A fun and easy way to introduce children to coding by customizing their own wand.
pros: Kids build their own wand and customize its functions using the Kano coding app – available on iOS, Android, and Apple or Windows computers
cons: Wand and app aren’t compatible with older tablets or operating systems

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievable product.  Great learning experience and a ton of fun for kids.
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the ability of this product to help my 10 year old daughter learn how to code. She's been interested in computers and loves Harry Potter so bringing them together in 1 experience is fantastic. The ability to learn the basics of coding then try your own work out right afterwards is incredibly rewarding for kids. She and all her friends at her birthday party were trying out all the different options with the wand and it made me feel much better than having a bunch of kids starting at iPads the whole time. The ability to both learn and entertain yourself seemingly endlessly is a really wonderful part of this product. Cannot recommend it enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer B. Kramer

customer_reviews.title: Great for your little Wizards
customer_reviews.text: I got this after a friend told me all about how awesome Kano is with coding products for kids. I personally love Harry Potter and the box the wand came in was awesome. The app that you download to program the wand( I used my Fire Tablet) is really bright colorful and engaging. I was surprised by how easy it was for my kids(ages 4 and 8) to jump right in and start coding. I was so intrigued I tried it myself, I have no coding experience whatsoever and I found the "instructions" to be very easy to follow and flowed very nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Key Amber

customer_reviews.title: Overall it's a good toy some glitches
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old loves it. It won't connect to any of our tablets which were all purchased this year and isn't ready for mobile yet. It does work on my computer though. My daughter said she had trouble a few times with it laging. Over all a very cool toy and has kept her busy for a few night so far. It just came out though so I expect the small glitches we have experienced will be cleared up quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Jodee T.

customer_reviews.title: App crashes repeatedly!
customer_reviews.text: The required App crashes repeatedly. I bought this for my daughter with a brand new Samsung Galaxy Tab A to play it on. The wand is good quality and seems to work fine. The required App, however, is extremely unstable. It crashes repeatedly causing the game to be unplayable. This would be a good product if it worked properly. I should have looked up the app on google store and read through the comments before buying.
customer_reviews.author: David Cutchin

customer_reviews.title: Magic for everyone!
customer_reviews.text: This wand is defintely a crowd pleaser! Originally for my 6 year old nephew, many adults in my family took to the fun and were interested in how to use it. The wand is certainly educational, functions very well, and looks fantastic all while providing good groundwork for kids to learn coding. The mini games, challenges, and directions were all very clear. I am so happy with this purchase! I'd reccomend this company and this product to anyone looking for an appropriate "toy" for their kids. The wand is exceptionally cool because it appeals to older kids-- even my 30 year old cousin was stocked to try it out!
customer_reviews.author: Olivia Thomes

customer_reviews.title: Great way to introduce kids to computing.... oh and they get to be a Wizard like Harry Potter
customer_reviews.text: I just spent the last hour and a half with my 6 year old daughter assembling and playing with the wand. At first, she was excited to play with Harry’s wand. But the more she played with it and saw how she could change what happened when she moved the wand, the more it became about seeing what she could make it do. We are just getting started but I can already tell that she is going to have a lot of fun with the wand and I can’t wait to see what she comes up with.
customer_reviews.author: Henry L Leibowitz

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!
customer_reviews.text: 50 Points for Hufflepuff! I am having so much fun learning to code with my new wand. Easy instructions and simple steps paired with wonderful design make coding easy and fun. Every detail; from the packaging, to the in app design, to the wand itself is pure magic. Would highly recommend for any aspiring witch or wizard.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey

customer_reviews.title: Easy, education and lots of fun
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 11 year old daughter, wasn't sure exactly how it would land. Smiles began from seeing Harry Potter and a magic wand. But the real magic happened once she began to get into the coding creating spells. Its simple, super engaging and a lot of fun - all the while giving her a totally different ipad experience, one where she is actually coding the 'game/spell'. A great gift idea - one that will not only get a big smile actually get used!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer A Hulford

customer_reviews.title: Fun and challenges for hours
customer_reviews.text: Leela (11)- It was easy to put together and the app challenges were fun. It has a lot of fun Harry Potter things. This was my first coding toy! Jack (12)- The wand comes in cool packaging. Building the wand was the best part in my opinion and you can take it apart to put it away so you don't lose pieces. The wand remembers where you were so you don't have to start over. *He ran to get the wand and play because we were talking about it, which is the best review of all!*
customer_reviews.author: Jack (12) & Leela (11)

customer_reviews.title: Great interactive product!
customer_reviews.text: My five year old was so excited when this arrived in the mail. I found myself admiring the packaging as he and my husband dove right into it. They had fun building the wand itself and when they synced it up to our ipad the magic really began to unfold. This product is scaffolded so that you can enjoy it at many different ages and level of play. I am excited to see how this helps introduce the world of coding to my kids and I love how it is inspired by literature!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: My son is a huge fan of coding, computers, and Harry Potter. When we discovered we could combine these passions with the Kano Harry Potter coding kit we knew we had to have it. When the box arrived my son ran to open it. He immediately jumped right in and loved building the wand and exploring the program. This is an excellent product for all children, from beginner coders to those who consider themselves experts. This will be a product my son spends time with. He is already going back to explore what else he can do with the program from his original experiences with it. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Levitan

customer_reviews.title: Am going to to return
customer_reviews.text: First of all, make sure your device has bluetooth. i ended up buying an adapter. I tried it on my Samsung tablet and kept losing wifi connection, couldn't download on my Dell chromebook, so I thought it could use my adapter. Bought the bluetooth adapter and then found out that I can't load the software. I am returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Ann Cassidy-Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Not Really Fun or Educational
customer_reviews.text: So, my 10 year old put it together (took 10 minutes or so). My husband and my 10 year old downloaded app and played with the wand. (20 minutes or so) Its kinda like having an awkward wand shaped mouse for this one program. 10 year old lost interest fast and most likely will not touched the thing again. The most educational things about it was the practice she got putting batteries in herself. So not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: E J D

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: As far as “giftability” my daughter was thrilled to receive this Harry Potter coding kit. We love Harry Potter and this was a great way to get her more interested in coding. However, the “magic” quickly faded as the app is so glitchy and clunky as to render the product unusable. I thought it might be my daughter, so I let some of my computer programming friends troubleshoot for me. They were as unimpressed as I was. At least I got assurance that my daughter was doing perfectly fine with coding- the product is sub-par.
customer_reviews.author: Pennsauken

customer_reviews.title: App Compatibility issues
customer_reviews.text: Reason for the 3 star rating: the app doesn't seem to be officially compatible with any Android devices or Windows 10 anymore. I tried a new phone with the latest Android OS, an older Android phone, an Amazon Fire Tablet, and a new Windows 10 PC and all of them said App not compatible. I was finally able to side load the App onto my son's Fire Tablet by finding the App download online. Once installed everything works great, just a bit of a struggle up to that point. Hopefully these compatibility issues will be fixed.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph H.

customer_reviews.title: The Perfect Gift/Purchase for all Harry Potter Fans
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my two sons after seeing a video online. They love Harry Potter and love this wand just as much. How cool is it to be able to not only build the wand, but to learn to code and control it as well?? They can’t stop smiling. This is the perfect gift for the Harry Potter fan in your life. It was for mine :-)
customer_reviews.author: EK1320

customer_reviews.title: Only buy if you have a newer iPad
customer_reviews.text: Does not reliably work and we are utterly exhausted trying to go through all of the associated troubleshooting steps which included buying a Bluetooth dongle, upgrading our windows version, etc. A huge disappointment. Don’t bother buying this unless you have a newer iPad. This didn’t work on any of our computers or older iPad minis even after following the steps (for the computers) that we were assured would work. And dear manufacturer: just say that it ONLY reliably works for iPads instead of making us laptop users spin our wheels. (I know it doesn’t work with Chromebooks - we weren’t using a Chromebook).
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Awful!  Broke after 1 use. TERRIBLE customer service!
customer_reviews.text: Cheap plastic garbage. Broke after a single use. Customer service is among the worst I have experienced in recent memory. They asked for more information and then went dark. Then they write telling me the matter was resolved and ticket is being closed. Unbelievable. Stay away from this product that disappoints kids.
customer_reviews.author: Greenacre

customer_reviews.title: Dangerous-Burned my son!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: The wand worked well at first, software worked well too. Instructions were easy. But then... My 8 year old son was using it and all of a sudden it got VERY hot in his hand! There was a SPARK AND HE GOT BURNED!!!!! When my husband and I grabbed it off the floor we could barely touch it because it was so hot. There was a puff of smoke when he took the batteries out!! I’m not sure what happened, there must be a short in it. We used the batteries that came with the wand and took them out when not in use as per the instructions.
customer_reviews.author: R. Reese

customer_reviews.title: Boo, hiss!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work with their own products and os. I got this thinking that my 8 year old daughter could use it with the kano computer she got last year, but no. There is an icon but when we click on it it says that it is not available for the Kano os yet. It's currently December 25 and this product has been available since September and they don't have it functional with their own os yet? Fail!
customer_reviews.author: Ivy and Claire's Mom

customer_reviews.title: A Wand-erful Experience!
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Being big fans of Harry Potter, it was great to share this magical experience with our 4 year old son. Even upon opening the packaging we were all instantly engaged with the beautiful high-end design. Our son loved being able to build the wand with us. Setup was easy on our iPad, the app was very user friendly! Interactivity with the wand was amazing and even our 4 year old was starting to get the hang of putting coding blocks together with the easy touch and drag interface. Definitely would recommend it as a great introduction to coding and fun game experience for your kids or as a gift... especially those who love the magic of Harry Potter!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Garber

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my daughter along with an Amazon Fire and it was not compatable even though it said that it should've been. I hope that the company will reach out to make this right with yhe customers. Hoping for a guarentee from the company that it will work with the technology that they assured on the description that it would. I believe tgere is a law that stands behind misinformation like this, but am going to see if the company will stand behind their product first.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Love Harry Potter but this item is extremely temporary
customer_reviews.text: Product doesn’t always work. Very finicky. Beautifully boxed, just wish it worked better.
customer_reviews.author: Nettie

customer_reviews.title: Hope you shelled out for a new tablet when you bought this.
customer_reviews.text: Luckily we have several tablets in our house because rather than writing a universal program, this software is extremely finicky about what version of tablet you have. It only works on about half of them. For the price, I full on expect that this would work on MOST tablets. Very odd that it can go to sleep, but has no on off switch. Kids taking batteries with a circuit board out every time to turn it off is south of ideal. Functionally once we got it working, my daughter loves the wand.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Check technical requirements
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up off the Amazon Treasure Truck for my 10 year old niece for Christmas. She loves it. Only downfall- check the technical requirements before purchasing. Out of two iPads, a Mac desktop computer, and two iMac laptops. Only one laptop is compatible with the kano app. You’re not able to do it on phones, wouldn’t work with an XS or XR iPhone. Would have earned 5 stars if would they make an app mobile friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon1

customer_reviews.title: So much fun with amazing customer service
customer_reviews.text: My daughter (9) loves this wand! She got it for Christmas and used it non stop. After 6 months of constant use, the battery connector shifted and stopped fully supplying power so I contacted Kano tech support. AMAZING customer service. They sent her a brand new wand free of charge to replace the one that wore out. And she still is loving the programming and the complete submersion into the harry potter world. We were able to get this wand on a lightening deal. Had we paid full price I may have been disappointed that it wore out but their customer service makes up for their prices. Great product, a little pricey, but worth it!
customer_reviews.author: K&SJ

customer_reviews.title: Programming incentive.
customer_reviews.text: A fun Harry Potter Potter experience. Does not teach coding well, but it gives young people a good reason to try out programming.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: This is an awesome product.
customer_reviews.text: Box looks perfect. I’m wrapping it for my son’s present. I think this is an awesome wizard wand to give because it’s not just merely a toy wand, he can learn coding from it too.
customer_reviews.author: J.C

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for Potter fans!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old is obsessed with Harry Potter and was beyond thrilled to receive this gift! I purchased this when it was 50% off for Christmas and that is the high end of what I would pay for it. Its a solid product and the app has worked well for us, but as the wand is plastic with a small board, most of the cost is app related. I definitely wouldn't have paid full price which it why it sat on my wish list for over a year. The actual product itself is highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3 stars for.....
customer_reviews.text: ..... not being able to use on a chrome book. I SHOULD have checked before buying this for my kid for xmas but I didn't. Its a good thing I have a desk top in my home office or this would have been sent back. NOW saying all that, my daughter loves playing with it and I love that she is learning.
customer_reviews.author: JenRuss

customer_reviews.title: Good concept - decent software - bad tracking
customer_reviews.text: The wand does not track very well... you constantly need to reset it. and it doesnt track movement well. Also, the software worked well on iPad not well on my PC. I wanted to love this, but it just wasnt good enough to keep
customer_reviews.author: Justin Massion

customer_reviews.title: Syncing problems but once done it works well.
customer_reviews.text: The wand is easy to assemble, my 10 year old did it by himself. Pairing the wand to our MacBook seems to be a big ordeal and it doesn’t always remember the wand. Not sure if that’s the computer issue or the wands issue. Once it is synced (after every disconnect) it works well and my son enjoys it! I didn’t realize when we bought it it was still in bata testing. Hopefully they will work that bug out!
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl

customer_reviews.title: Abra-cadabra Amazing!
customer_reviews.text: Love this new wand. The instructions actually teaches your child about each part so they understand what each part is used for. Instructions recommend removing battery when not using, but it’s not so easy for little fingers. I’m hoping it doesn’t burn through them too quickly without removing them. A bonus is it does come with 2 sets of batteries - it seems no toys come with batteries these days!
customer_reviews.author: Georgia Girl

customer_reviews.title: No power switch?!?!
customer_reviews.text: Very cool. My 7 year old is able to use it about an hour at a time before she gets fatigued with it. Works better when the tablet is on some sort of stand. There are two things I wish it had: 1) A power switch. Taking the thing apart everytime is going to be a pain and the plastics will eventually break. 2) The tip should be able to be used with a tablet so it can be used like a stylus.
customer_reviews.author: ChewieDaWookiee

customer_reviews.title: Fun when it works
customer_reviews.text: When it's working this is a fun kit. My son is already interested in coding and enjoys Harry Potter so this was a natural choice for him. He took to it right away. However, linking the wand to his tablet has not been as smooth as you'd hope for a toy aimed at kids. It's not something I can reliably hand him to play whenever.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Korte

customer_reviews.title: Fun you BUT...
customer_reviews.text: Loved this product, very innovated idea and my daughter has had a loads of fun with it...however, I do not love the fact tjat there is no off switch to the wand meaning to preserve battery life you must remove batteries after each round of play. That my friends is annoying. I feel an off switch would have been easy to install considering how tech savvy this toy is meant to be.
customer_reviews.author: IvorySkywalker

customer_reviews.title: Garbage, does not work with any of the Fire tablets we own
customer_reviews.text: Ok, this is garbage. This app shows as currently unavailable in the app store for Amazon. And a call to the company was not helpful, basically this does not even work on a kindle fire bought less than a year ago, that is really a problem.
customer_reviews.author: DEG0

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy- zero stars
customer_reviews.text: Finally pulled these out of the box to try and they are no longer supported by Kindle Fire. You'd think that by now, more than a year later, they'd have stuff figured out, but no. Just found out we have about $200 worth of disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: JaimeRC

customer_reviews.title: Constantly losing its connection
customer_reviews.text: My son and I tried to use this on an iPad. It was constantly losing its connection. We kept having to close the app and repair/open the app to get it to work again (for a few minutes) before needing to start all over again. If I didn't get this for a fraction of their normal price I'd send it back for a refund. We also bought the star wars kit and it has the same issues. I'm guessing it has something to do with their app or perhaps the hardware they are using to connect via bluetooth. Pretty disappointed in it.
customer_reviews.author: Noelle Christensen

customer_reviews.title: Coding fun!
customer_reviews.text: This is a product that's great fun for kids AND adults! It definitely turns programming into a more interactive experience, and the Harry Potter theme is great bonus for those who are fans of the series.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Jenness

customer_reviews.title: Totally Worth it!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I admit I never write reviews, but I feel like this definitely warrants one. My kids and I love this product!! The packaging is super sleek and the instruction manual was sooooo easy to follow. I know nothing about coding, but my kids have really taken an interest to STEM toys. We have completed a couple of the spells and can't wait to see what comes next. My kids love that you can create your own little character. It's so great that this is something that we can do together as a family and learn!!! Two thumbs up for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Dan D

customer_reviews.title: Very Cool Kid Learning toy
customer_reviews.text: Bought it last Christmas and the kids still use it at least once every other week. hours of fun and learning at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: Nsiddons

customer_reviews.title: Simply does not work
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son as a gift. It would not connect to either my iPad mini, iPad Pro, MacBook Pro, HP laptop or desktop. I contacted kano's support without help. It simply won't connect!
customer_reviews.author: JJJMOM

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably bad...
customer_reviews.text: We were going excited to use this thing. I bought it for my daughter for Xmas. The app you use this thing on is the WORST. How can you teach kids coding when the people who coded this app created the worst thing ever. Used on a brand new computer, the app is glitchy, it freezes constantly. This was 99 bucks at target. I got it for half that price on amazon, and it’s still a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: luthercorp

customer_reviews.title: 3rd times a charm Kano...
customer_reviews.text: I originally gave this item glowing reviews but I came back to edit. After 3 weeks of light use it now is a glitchy mess. If you program right then it only responds up and so forth. Plus I get endless emails trying to pull my kid in to online stuff. I am done. It is junk. Going to return it before my window runs out.
customer_reviews.author: Seattlerain

customer_reviews.title: Much better than expected.
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 8 year old gifted daughter for Christmas. She does coding in her gifted class at school so she took right to this toy. She enjoyed the process of building the wand and is working through the app. She hasn't needed much help from me and really enjoying the app and wand. Seems like a great buy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor P.

customer_reviews.title: Neat idea, doesn’t execute well.
customer_reviews.text: Neat idea, doesn’t execute well. The wand always seems to get off of center and it is not very easy to get it to re-center. This makes it hard to get the programs to do what they should. My seven year old got frustrated with it and hasn’t played with it since he tried it once on Christmas day. He has tried it on his iPad mini.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: It is fun when it works
customer_reviews.text: This could be a great gift but, unfortunately, the app keeps going down or the wand does not work correctly. My child had great patience with this but it would frustrate her when the app would freeze. Wish I could give this higher ratings because the idea is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Juhnay

customer_reviews.title: Great idea, horrible execution.  DOESN’T WORK, NO APP SUPPORT.
customer_reviews.text: This coding wand and app is a great idea. I was just as excited to try this as my eight year old that got it for Christmas. However, the app is a complete failure, and you are dependent on the app to do anything with this wand. Do you apple freeze and lock up every five minutes causing you to restart all your work. You can’t get anywhere without the app working this is a complete waste of money until they fix the software.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Grandt

customer_reviews.title: Harry Potter?
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping for a Harry Potter experience. Not even the music from the movies.
customer_reviews.author: O

customer_reviews.title: BEST birthday present for 7 year old son!
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our 7 year old son who is obsessed with Harry Potter! He has done some very basic coding before (bee bots) but this was so much more fun and entertaining! From the minute we opened the package we both became enthralled with it. This was by far one of the best gifts he has ever received and I know that it will get tons and tons of use!
customer_reviews.author: Brian G

customer_reviews.title: STEAM gifts
customer_reviews.text: Bought for Christmas gift. 9 year old loves using his chrome book so hope he enjoys it
customer_reviews.author: Woodz

customer_reviews.title: Slap a HP logo on anything and we'll buy it!
customer_reviews.text: Super glitchy. We tried it on different devices and it would freeze, not respond...my 14 yr old was super excited to get it but after a while has abandoned it because its not working. She'll go back eventually but shame they didnt do more debugging - Ive read some reviews that its a common problem.
customer_reviews.author: Monica

customer_reviews.title: Very repetitive
customer_reviews.text: Game asks you to basically do the same “coding” over and over again with the result not being very impressive. My 7 year old grew bored after about 10 minutes. Not very impressive for the cost. Presentation is beautiful though.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift for Harry Potter fan!
customer_reviews.text: Got this as a gift and now I wish I got myself one. It's great for kids to help learn about coding. Even better for a HP fan who loves to practice spells!
customer_reviews.author: CeeCee

customer_reviews.title: Dissapointing
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a 12 year old. He loves this kind of stuff. Even bought a new tablet to accommodate it. The app is really bad. Doesn't work. Seems like wand needs to be calibrated. I am very annoyed. If they are going to charge so much for a product the app better work.
customer_reviews.author: Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Defect Product! Dangerous
customer_reviews.text: I bought two during as X'mas gift for my girl and her best friend. Be aware, if you leave the wand on, it gets really really hot and my daughter's friend burned her hand even. I will definitely return the product and file complain with manufacturer. Please don't buy this product. It's a potential risk to the kids burning their hands.
customer_reviews.author: J.L

customer_reviews.title: Oh what fun
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my 11 year old grandson for Christmas and he loved it. It sparked an interest in coding and now he is going to coding camp this summer. Great educational toy that really worked.
customer_reviews.author: bellicent

customer_reviews.title: A little glitchy, but a great toy
customer_reviews.text: 4 stars because, despite the issues, my son LOVES this. As many other reviewers have experienced, the wand disconnects from the tablet bluetooth frequently and needs to be reconnected. It gets annoying and frustrates my son a bit, but he still really loves to show off all the spells he has done with the coding!
customer_reviews.author: R Fitz

customer_reviews.title: Neat idea and the niece loves it
customer_reviews.text: My 11- year old niece loves it! Harry Potter obsessed and it looked super cool to me as a grown up. Love a good STEM gift
customer_reviews.author: AntOB

customer_reviews.title: A magical product
customer_reviews.text: I bought the wand for my 6 yr. old son for Christmas. He hasn’t put it down...literally. Kudos to Kano. This is our 2nd Kano product & this is by far my sons favorite. The wand comes nicely packaged. Once my son opened up the box he easily followed the very detailed instructions on how to build the wand. In minutes my son was using the wand and learning the world of coding. Such a great learning tool. And it never hurts when you add a little wizardry & magic in!
customer_reviews.author: nicole l markon

customer_reviews.title: Don't disappoint your child
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my ten year old for Christmas morning...EPIC FAIL DO NOT DISSAPOINT YOUR CHILD WITH THIS CRAP. I have iPad, Polaroid tablets, Samsung tablet. Nothing works Bluetooth will not connect software says may not be optimized for your device. JUNK will be sending back immediately. Sure that will not go well either.
customer_reviews.author: Mo

customer_reviews.title: App for wand didn't work
customer_reviews.text: The app for this wand wouldn't work on any of our devises. The wand itself was pretty cool, but without the use of the app it rendered it useless. Very disappointed 8 year old. Had to return it.
customer_reviews.author: Clint/Aly

customer_reviews.title: Too many bugs in app
customer_reviews.text: The app for this product has a lot of bugs. We used it probably for 1 hour and I had to restart the app probably 5-10 times (the screen would just go blank). Also, during the challenges, it would tell you to drag the code blocks on the screen ... I had to restart the challenges several times also because it would not recognize that we completed a step. This is a great concept, but do not buy until they come u with a better app to go with it. My son completely lost interest because of the bugs. We used with an amazon fire 8hd tablet
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Bummer
customer_reviews.text: The interface was clunky. My 10 year old was definitely unimpressed. Came out of the box once after Christmas and never again. The box got destroyed over the holidays or else I would have definitely returned.
customer_reviews.author: AshleyM

customer_reviews.title: Pretty neat for any youth Potter fan
customer_reviews.text: Later levels can be a bit hard for my 5th grader
customer_reviews.author: M or J

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas gift for my kids. The wand WILL NOT stay connected to bluetooth. After months of troubleshooting from the wand and laptop side, still no better. The kids lost interest pretty quickly. Games are no fun if they break every few minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Keshia Swaim

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gift!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and run! My Harry Potter obsessed 9 year old enjoyed making spells. She codes a bunch at school so she knew exactly how to get it going.

product_meta.title: Kano Harry Potter Coding Kit – Build a Wand. Learn To Code. Make Magic.
product_meta.description:
Build your own wand. Learn to code with step-by-step creative challenges. Make magic on a screen, with a wave, twist, and twirl. Create, share, and play with the Kano community.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
feature_bullets: Build a Wand that responds to your movements. Comes with wand parts, PCB with Codeable LED, button, batteries, step-by-step book, stickers, poster, and free Kano app. Tablet not included.
Learn to code with 70+ step-by-step creative challenges. Make feathers fly, goblets multiply, fire flow, pumpkins grow, and more.
Wave your wand and see instant effects on screen. Create with creatures, sweets, spells, 200+ exclusive sounds, music, and wizarding artefacts.
Endless play with Kano world. Remix art, games, and music made by a creative community.
No coding experience necessary. Includes Lifetime care and 1 year Warranty. Ages 6+.

Requires Bluetooth low energy (Bluetooth Smart 4.0 or newer). works with Windows 10 Pro & home, Mac OS 10.10, iOS 10 (selected iPad models only), Android 5.0 (tablets only), Amazon Fire tablets (8 HD 2016 or newer). full hardware and software requirements Can be found below.
